org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.internal.system

Class Watchdog

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.internal.system.Watchdog

  • public class Watchdog
extends java.lang.Object
    A watchdog class that, if not stroked often enough barks, executes some action, and then dies. Emphasis: Will only bark once. To bark again, it must be explicitly restarted.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Watchdog(java.lang.Runnable bark, int period, long timeout, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
      Creates a watchdog instance
      Watchdog(java.lang.Runnable bark, java.lang.Runnable growl, int growlTime, int period, long timeout, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
      Creates a watchdog instance that will growl a warning that it's about to bark

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected void checkDog()
      checkDog Have we gotten any attention lately? If not, bark.
      void euthanize()
      euthanize Kills the watchdog.
      boolean isRunning() 
      void start()
      Start the watchdog.
      void stroke()
      stroke Keeps the dog happy.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Watchdog

        public Watchdog(java.lang.Runnable bark,
                int period,
                long timeout,
                java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
        Creates a watchdog instance
        Parameters:
        bark - The action to take should the watchdog not get stroked.
        period - The interval, in time units between checking the dog.
        timeout - The timeout defining not often enough.
        unit - The unit of time for the time values.

      • Watchdog

        public Watchdog(java.lang.Runnable bark,
                java.lang.Runnable growl,
                int growlTime,
                int period,
                long timeout,
                java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
        Creates a watchdog instance that will growl a warning that it's about to bark
        Parameters:
        bark - The action to take should the watchdog not get stroked.
        growl - The action to take should the watchdog growl.
        growlTime - The amount of time before a bark that the watchdog will growl.
        period - The interval, in time units between checking the dog.
        timeout - The timeout defining not often enough.
        unit - The unit of time for the time values.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        Start the watchdog.

      • stroke

        public void stroke()
        stroke Keeps the dog happy. Prevents it from barking.

      • euthanize

        public void euthanize()
        euthanize Kills the watchdog. May be resurrected with start() without creating a new instance.

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()

      • checkDog

        protected void checkDog()
        checkDog Have we gotten any attention lately? If not, bark.
